glsa.title: Libreswan: Multiple Vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libreSwan possibly resulting in Denial of Service.

background.p: Libreswan is a free software implementation of the most widely supported and standarized VPN protocol based on (“IPsec”) and the Internet Key Exchange (“IKE”).

description.p: The pluto IKE daemon in Libreswan, when built with NSS, allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service (assertion failure and daemon restart) via a zero DH g^x value in a KE payload in a IKE packet. Additionally, remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service (daemon restart) via an IKEv1 packet with (1) unassigned bits set in the IPSEC DOI value or (2) the next payload value set to ISAKMP_NEXT_SAK.

impact.p: Remote attackers could possibly cause Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
